chapter.title: ⪪ Installation
chapter.para: ⪪ is included in &sls; starting with version 12 SP1. To install it, start &sls; installation, and click Software on the Installation Settings screen. Select the Subscription Management Tool pattern on the Software Selection and System Tasks screen, then click OK.

tip.title: Installing ⪪ on an Existing System
tip.para: To install ⪪ on the existing &sls; system, run &yast;SoftwareSoftware Management, select ViewPatterns and select the ⪪ pattern there.

chapter.para: It is recommended to check for available ⪪ updates immediately after installing &sls; using the zypper patch command. &suse; continuously releases maintenance updates for ⪪, and newer packages are likely to be available.
After the system is installed and updated, perform an initial ⪪ configuration using &yast;Network Services⪪ Configuration Wizard.

note.title: Install smt-client
note.para: The smt-client package needs to be installed on clients connected to the ⪪ server. The package requires no configuration, and it can be installed using the sudo zypper in smt-client command.

sect1.title: ⪪ Configuration Wizard
sect1.para: The two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard helps you configure ⪪ after &sls; installation is finished. You can change the configuration later using the &yast; ⪪ Server Configuration module—see .

step.para: The Enable Subscription Management Tool service (⪪) option is enabled by default. Toggle it only if you want to disable the ⪪ product.
If the firewall is enabled, enable Open Port in Firewall to allow access to the ⪪ service from remote computers.

Enter your &scc; organization credentials in User and Password. If you do not know your &scc; credentials, refer to . Test the entered credentials using the Test button. ⪪ will connect to the Customer Center server using the provided credentials and download testing data.
Enter the e-mail address you used for the &scc; registration into SCC E-mail Used for Registration.
Your ⪪ Server URL should contain the URL of the ⪪ server being configured. It is populated automatically.
Click Next to continue to the second configuration step.
For security reasons, ⪪ requires a separate user to connect to the database. In the Database Password for smt User screen, set the database password for this user.
Enter all e-mail addresses for receiving ⪪ reports using the Add button. Use the Edit and Delete buttons to modify and delete the existing addresses. When you have done that, click Next.
If the current database root password is empty, you will be prompted to specify it.

By default, ⪪ is set to communicate with the client hosts via a secure protocol. For this, the server needs to have a server SSL certificate. The wizard displays a warning if the certificate does not exist. You can create a certificate using the Run CA Management button. Refer to for detailed information on managing certificates with &yast;.

sect1.title: Upgrading from Previous Versions of ⪪
sect1.para: This section provides information on upgrading ⪪ from the previous versions.

important.title: Upgrade from Versions Prior to 11 SP3
important.para: A direct upgrade path from ⪪ prior to version 11 SP3 is not supported. You need to do the following:

sect2.title: Upgrade from ⪪ 12 SP1
sect2.para: Upgrade from ⪪ 12 SP1 is performed automatically during the &sls; upgrade and requires no additional manual steps. For more information on &sls; upgrade, see .

sect3.title: Migration to &scc; on ⪪ 11 SP3
sect3.para: Before upgrading to &sls; 12, you need to switch the registration center on &sls; 11. ⪪ now registers with &scc; instead of Novell Customer Center. You can do this either via a &yast; module or command line tools.

Before performing the switch between customer centers, make sure that the target customer center serves all products that are registered with ⪪. Both &yast; and the command line tools perform a check to find out whether all products can be served with the new registration server.
To perform the migration to &scc; via command line, use the following command:
The migration itself takes time, and during the migration process the ⪪ server may not be able to serve clients that are already registered.
The migration process itself changes the registration server and the proper type of API in the configuration files. No further (configuration) changes are needed on the ⪪.
To migrate from Novell Customer Center to &scc; via &yast;, use the &yast; smt-server module.

sect1.title: Enabling SLP Announcements
sect1.para: ⪪ includes the SLP service description file (/etc/slp.reg.d/smt.reg). To enable SLP announcements of the ⪪ service, open respective ports in your firewall and enable the SLP service:
sect1.screen: sysconf_addword /etc/sysconfig/SuSEfirewall2 FW_SERVICES_EXT_TCP "427" sysconf_addword /etc/sysconfig/SuSEfirewall2 FW_SERVICES_EXT_UDP "427" insserv slpd rcslpd start
